svg.desc: The chart shows voter turnout in the last two Landtag elections in each federal state as a percentage of eligible electorate. In Hesse, Baden-Württemberg, Rhineland-Palatinate, Bavaria, Berlin, Saarland, Saxony-Anhalt, Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, Schleswig-Holstein and North Rhine-Westphalia, voter turnout has increased. In these federal states, voter turnout at the last two Landtag elections stood between 61 percent in Saxony-Anhalt and 73 percent in Hesse. In Thuringia, Bremen, Saxony and Brandenburg, voter turnout has dropped and stood between 48 percent in Brandenburg and 53 percent in Thuringia. In Lower Saxony and Hamburg there was hardly any change, with figures of 56 percent in Hamburg and 59 percent in Lower Saxony.

div.p:
Source: German Federal Statistical Office, Election Statistics, June 7, 2017.
Updated data
